page.title: 11Near Grantham:Coldharbour
page.content: Coldharbour lies to the south east of Grantham at the modern junction of Ermine St. and the A52 road to Boston.The place name means an inhospitable place generally on an ancient road.Grantham's Coldharbour is on the old track of the Roman road to Lincoln,now called the High Dyke.There is a large house called Blue Harbour which used to be a public house.There is also a farm house which is not lived in and four other houses.The farm out buildings are used for the storage of hay Opposite,across the High Dyke there is a Government Vehicle Inspection Station where heavy lorries undergo the annual Ministry of Transport test of roadworthiness.This is on the edge of the old Spitalgate Airfield and nearby there are some relics of wartime storage bunkers.
